description: Language development talk involves discussions about words, communication, vocabulary, grammar, reading, writing, and language skills. It includes metalinguistic awareness and explicit language learning.
characteristics: Discusses words, vocabulary, or language explicitly
Involves reading, writing, or literacy skills
Shows vocabulary development and word learning

examples.text: That's a big word. What does it mean? Can you explain it? I want to learn new words. Vocabulary is important.
I can read this sentence. Look, I know these words. Reading helps me learn. Books teach me new things.
I'm writing my name. These are letters. A-B-C. I know the alphabet. Letters make words.
I said that wrong. Let me try again. The right way to say it is... I'm learning to speak better.
That word sounds funny. It rhymes with cat. Words that sound the same are rhymes. I like rhyming words.
I'm telling a story with lots of words. I'm using describing words. Adjectives make it interesting. Language is fun.
I understand what you're saying. You're communicating with me. We're having a conversation. Talking is how we share ideas.
This is a sentence. It has a subject and a verb. Grammar helps us make sense. I'm learning sentence structure.
I learned a new word today. It means happy. Synonyms are words that mean the same. Language has many words.
I'm speaking clearly so you can understand. Pronunciation matters. When I talk, I want to be understood. Communication is important.
